facts.title: The Sun is the center of the Solar System
facts.fact: The Sun is the most important source of energy for life on Earth. It accounts for ~98.86% of the total mass of the Solar System.

facts.title: Suns Composition
facts.fact: The sun mostly consists of Hydrogen (70%) and Helium(28%).

facts.title: Suns Shape
facts.fact: The sun is the closest thing to a perfect sphere that has been observed in nature.

facts.title: Light
facts.fact: Light from the Sun takes appoximately 8 minutes to reach earth.

facts.title: North Star
facts.fact: Polaris is known as the North Star due to its location in the Northern Sky. All other stars apear to revolve around Polaris.

facts.title: Earths Axis
facts.fact: Earths axis is pointed almost directly at Polaris. The position of Polaris allows it to remain motionless in the sky when viewing from earth.

facts.title: Triple Star System
facts.fact: Polaris is part of a Triple Star System which includes Polaris Aa, Polaris Ab, and Polaris B.

facts.title: Future Location
facts.fact: Due to Polaris moving away from the celestial pole, it will not always be the Northern Star

facts.title: Brightneess
facts.fact: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky, it is about 25 times brighter than our Sun.

facts.title: Binary Star System
facts.fact: The Sirus System is one of Earths closest neighbors. It is a binary star system made up of Sirius A and Sirius B

facts.title: Size
facts.fact: Sirius A is about doubled the size of the sun while Sirius B is smaller than earth

facts.title: Location
facts.fact: Sirius is gradually moving closer to the Solar System.

facts.title: Alpha Centauri
facts.fact: Proxima Centauri is part of a Triple Star System Alpha Centauri.

facts.title: Distance to Sun
facts.fact: Proxima Centauri is the closest known star to our Sun.

facts.title: Planets
facts.fact: Proxima Centauri has two known planets

facts.title: Visibility
facts.fact: Although Proxima Centauri is the closest star to our Solar System, it is not visible to the naked eye.

facts.title: System
facts.fact: Betelgeuse is considered a single isolated star not associated with as cluster.

facts.title: Size
facts.fact: Betelgeuse is one of the largest stars visible to the naked eye.

facts.title: Dimming
facts.fact: Betelgeuse has been dimming noticeably since 2019.

facts.title: Evolution
facts.fact: Betelgeuse is expected to end its evolution with a supernova explosion within 100,000 years.
